title: Imaging method reveals long-lived patterns in cells of the eye

title_detail.value: Imaging method reveals long-lived patterns in cells of the eye

summary: Cells of the retinal pigment epithelium (RPE) form unique patterns that can be used to track changes in this important layer of tissue in the back of the eye, researchers have found. Using a combination of adaptive optics imaging and a fluorescent dye, the researchers used the RPE patterns to track individual cells in healthy volunteers and people with retinal disease.
